name: Andreola Hotel

reviews.title: Amazing Andreola Central Hotel
reviews.text: If we were to find fault with this hotel it would be...................... Sorry! Cannot think of one. This hotel far exceeded our expectations. It was quiet and warm (January 2004) at night with a good buzz during the day. The staff at Reception and in general could not have been more helpful. We will be back again.

reviews.title: Good location
reviews.text: Located in a quiet area, just three minute walk from Milan central station. Room was OK, clean and comfortable. But I found it rather difficult to get some information from the front desk because he (only one person) was always busy doing something else. If you are not a first time visitor of Milan, it would not be a problem. I will use this hotel again if I have to take very early trains.

reviews.title: Very mixed feelings
reviews.text: I booked the Andreola in good hope after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. The one or two poor reviews proved to be completely justified, and left me questioning the reviews praising this hotel, espescially the one from India which was only last week. Upon arrival we were glad to see the proximity to the central station, and always remembered to bear in mind that we were paying very reasonable prices in contrast to other Milan hotels. The reception gave us a warm welcome and check in was smooth, until we were told our rooms wouldn't be ready for another hour! We were then told there was no Diet Coke, which amused me after reading the other review that also said this. Finally our rooms were accessible after an hour. SHOCK! I booked two junior suites and was given two twin rooms, small, cramped, one with a slanty-loft-style ceiling and windows 8ft high! the other with a bad smell and masses of scaffolding and construction outside! I couldn't believe it! I approached reception and experienced rude, poor replies. First they insisted our room was a junior suite, when i asked to see a double room they refused! Then finally they agreed to move our room with the construction and smell - during this room change i happened to notice housekeeping cleaning a room, with wooden floors and popped my head in - i wanted to scream - the photograph of MY junior suite, on their website was in front of me on a piece of paper - and i was standing inside the same room! SPACIOUS, wonderfully furnished, and huge bathroom - JUNIOR SUITE! Did i receive this room, that i was paying for and BOOKED ? NO, instead another pokey room was given to us. We decided to leave it and get on with our day, after all we only had two days. Location was good for the prices, and breakfast was ample - service receives no marks, except for one bell-boy who kindly ran out at 9pm to get us some pizza and other food as the restaurant offering room service was closed for refurbishment till september. In general i would only go back to the Andreola once they have reviewed customer service and satisfaction levels, and finnished all their extensive refurbishment - this hotel has great amounts of potential, they are half there. Unfortunately I am left disappointed.

reviews.title: Great Start to Italy
reviews.text: Andreola was a great start to Italy. The hotel was a very pleasant surprise. For the price, the room was fabulous, nice and warm. The buffet breakfast very good (hot buffet including bacon and eggs). Room amneties were very good and the bathrooms spotlessly clean. The nice and spacious lobby was the icing on the cake. The staff were very helpful and nice. Great Place. Highly reccomended.

reviews.title: Won't be back to Milan
reviews.text: Arrived here on Friday 25 June 2004 and were pleased with the welcome we received from the Reception staff who were helpful. The room was small and clean but the view from the window left a lot to be desired. We were treated to a view of a back court which was covered in scaffolding. Breakfast was good, however, the waitressing staff could look a bit more pleasant. One lady, with blonde hair, must have practised looking miserable because she did it so well! We saw several residents trying to communicate with her, and we can appreciate that she might not have spoken any English, but a smile is a universal barrier breaker. Food was beautifully fresh and replenished regularly. Orange juice was ok, but this is the usual in hotels abroad.
The bar man ran out of Diet Coke on the first night of our visit. Whilst we accept that this can happen, we found it difficult to believe that they still hadn't bought some more by Sunday!
reviews.title: Fabulous - Value for money
fantastico!!!!
reviews.text: The location isn't very nice and we were surprised at how much grafitti there is in the surrounding area. Definitely not one of the best areas of Milan. Accommodation prices were good, but Milan doesn't seem to have the same grading system as the UK and we would say that this was no more than a 3 star rating in the UK.

reviews.title: Andreola Central Hotel exceeded our expectations
reviews.text: We flew into Malpensa airport and took the shuttle bus to the train station( Milano Centrale) The hotel was indeed a short 2 blocks from the station. The only noise was from the local streetcar and it was minimal. The room was more than adequate considering the price which was much less than others in the area I had researched. The breakfast was very good with many options. The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. Our skis did not make our connection and the desk manager called and faxed British Air to make sure they would reach us in Switzerland ASAP. This was extremely helpful, as I did not speak Italian. This is not a 5 star hotel but more than adequate for our needs while in transit in Milan. I'd definitely stay there again. The cost of the room was as advertised -no surprises. Easy access to the trains as well as the shuttle to the airport and lccal subways. The restaurant the desk recommended was just a block away and was excellent. All in all -- a very good experience.

reviews.title: Great hotel!
reviews.text: I recently came back from a trip to Europe where my wife and I stayed at the Andreola Hotel in Milan. It was a great little hotel! The room was small but nicely decorated and had many convenient features. The huge windows opened up into the center courtyard with those classic Italian style shutters. unfortunately, renovation was going on so it wasn't much of a view. Breakfast was included with our price and it was great! All kinds of really, really delicious pastries, prosciutto and other thinly sliced meats, all kinds of juices, excellent coffee... I could go on and on. The location doesn't look all that great but it's only two blocks from the central train station which was convenient for us as we were traveling to different countries.

reviews.title: Not worth
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and I thought this hotel does not worth for the price. I stayed at another hotel as well and it was much better than this although the price is almost the same.

reviews.title: Great value, no problem
reviews.text: The location is good as it is close to the Central Station, but I will not stay at this hotel any more.

reviews.title: Good location but noisy a/c
reviews.text: To me, this is just a 2-star-hotel.

description: The Hotel Andreola Central is one of the many historical 4-star hotels in Milan that opened at the same time the Central train station moved to its current location, originally behind the Spanish walls (currently Piazza della Repubblica). The hotel is located in Via Scarlatti, an extension to the Central train station's Galleria delle Carrozze which ends in Corso Bueonos Aires. Over the long and venerable years since its establishment, many VIPs have patronized the hotel: Fausto Coppi, the bicycle champion, prize-winning boxer Primo Carnera and Italian soccer stars during the sixties when the first player contracts were negotiated.
